comment.author: 22572662@N05
comment._content: The older residents would have still remembered it being called Bytown.

comment.author: 43661283@N00
comment._content: That would have been just under the falls, right? Victoria Island perhaps? I'm an admin for a group called Chaudière Falls - Ottawa/Gatineau, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 81556146@N00
comment._content: The photo was probably taken on Lebreton Flats, the centre of the lumbering industry in Ottawa and the major employer, even after the federal capital was established in Ottawa. It was called Bytown after Lt-Col John By who was in charge of the construction of the Rideau Canal from Ottawa to Kingston.
